item.title: SplitIterator
item.description:
Mojo struct ðŸ¡­

SplitIterator

@memory_only
struct SplitIterator[is_mutable: Bool, //, origin: Origin[is_mutable]]
Get an iterator the yields the splits from the input `to_split` string.

TODO: these test run fine in the test module, but not in doctests.

```
from testing import assert_equal
from ExtraMojo.bstr.bstr import SplitIterator
var input = "ABCD	EFGH	IJKL

MNOP".as_bytes() var expected = List( “ABCD”.as_bytes(), “EFGH”.as_bytes(), “IJKL MNOP”.as_bytes() ) var output = ListSpan[UInt8, StaticConstantOrigin] for value in SplitIterator(input, ord(" “)): output.append(value) for i in range(len(expected)): assert_equal(StringSlice(unsafe_from_utf8=output[i]), StringSlice(unsafe_from_utf8=expected[i])) ```

```
from collections.string.string_slice import StringSlice
from memory import Span
from testing import assert_equal
from ExtraMojo.bstr.bstr import SplitIterator

var input = "ABCD	EFGH	IJKL

MNOP”.as_bytes() var expected = List( “ABCD”.as_bytes(), “EFGH”.as_bytes(), “IJKL MNOP”.as_bytes() ) var iter = SplitIterator(input, ord(" “)) var first = iter.next() var peek = iter.peek() var second = iter.next() assert_equal(StringSlice(unsafe_from_utf8=peek.value()), StringSlice(unsafe_from_utf8=second)) assert_equal(StringSlice(unsafe_from_utf8=first), StringSlice(unsafe_from_utf8=expected[0])) assert_equal(StringSlice(unsafe_from_utf8=second), StringSlice(unsafe_from_utf8=expected[1])) ```

  • origin (Origin[is_mutable])

item.title: find
item.description:
Mojo function ðŸ¡­

find

âž•  âž– 
fn find(haystack: Span[SIMD[uint8, 1], origin], needle: Span[SIMD[uint8, 1], origin]) -> Optional[Int]

Look for the substring needle in the haystack. This is not a terribly smart find implementation. It will use memchr to find occurrences of the first byte in the needle, it then checks the subsequent bytes to see if they match the rest of the needle.

from testing import assert_equal
from ExtraMojo.bstr.bstr import find

var haystack = "ABCDEFGhijklmnop".as_bytes()
var expected = 4
var answer = find(haystack, "EFG".as_bytes()).value()
assert_equal(answer, expected)

Args:

  • haystack (Span[SIMD[uint8, 1], origin]): The bytes to be searched for the needle.
  • needle (Span[SIMD[uint8, 1], origin]): The bytes to search for in the haystack.

Returns:

Optional[Int]: Index of the start of the first occurrence of needle.

item.title: find_chr_all_occurrences
item.description:
Mojo function ðŸ¡­

find_chr_all_occurrences

âž•  âž– 
fn find_chr_all_occurrences(haystack: Span[SIMD[uint8, 1], origin], chr: SIMD[uint8, 1]) -> List[Int]

Find all the occurrences of chr in the input buffer. 

from testing import assert_equal
from ExtraMojo.bstr.bstr import find_chr_all_occurrences

var haystack = "ATCGACCATCGAGATCATGTTTCAT"
var expected = List(2, 5, 6, 9, 15, 22)
assert_equal(find_chr_all_occurrences(haystack.as_bytes(), ord("C")), expected)

Args:

  • haystack (Span[SIMD[uint8, 1], origin])
  • chr (SIMD[uint8, 1])

Returns:

List[Int]

item.title: is_ascii_lowercase
item.description:
Mojo function ðŸ¡­

is_ascii_lowercase

âž•  âž– 
fn is_ascii_lowercase(value: SIMD[uint8, 1]) -> Bool

Check if a byte is ASCII lowercase. 

from testing import assert_true, assert_false
from ExtraMojo.bstr.bstr import is_ascii_lowercase

for ascii_letter in range(ord("A"), ord("Z")+1):
    assert_false(is_ascii_lowercase(ascii_letter))
for ascii_letter in range(ord("a"), ord("z")+1):
    assert_true(is_ascii_lowercase(ascii_letter))
assert_false(is_ascii_lowercase(0))

Args:

  • value (SIMD[uint8, 1])

Returns:

Bool

item.title: is_ascii_uppercase
item.description:
Mojo function ðŸ¡­

is_ascii_uppercase

âž•  âž– 
fn is_ascii_uppercase(value: SIMD[uint8, 1]) -> Bool

Check if a byte is ASCII uppercase. 

from testing import assert_true, assert_false
from ExtraMojo.bstr.bstr import is_ascii_uppercase

for ascii_letter in range(ord("A"), ord("Z")+1):
    assert_true(is_ascii_uppercase(ascii_letter))
for ascii_letter in range(ord("a"), ord("z")+1):
    assert_false(is_ascii_uppercase(ascii_letter))
assert_false(is_ascii_uppercase(0))

Args:

  • value (SIMD[uint8, 1])

Returns:

Bool

item.title: to_ascii_lowercase
item.description:
Mojo function ðŸ¡­

to_ascii_lowercase

âž•  âž– 
fn to_ascii_lowercase(mut buffer: List[SIMD[uint8, 1], hint_trivial_type])

Lowercase all ascii a-zA-Z characters. 

from testing import assert_equal
from ExtraMojo.bstr.bstr import to_ascii_lowercase
var test = List("ABCdefgHIjklmnOPQRSTUVWXYZABCdefgHIjklmnOPQRSTUVWXYZABCdefgHIjklmnOPQRSTUVWXYZABCdefgHIjklmnOPQRSTUVWXYZABCdefgHIjklmnOPQRSTUVWXYZ".as_bytes())
var expected = List("abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyzabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz".as_bytes())
to_ascii_lowercase(test)
assert_equal(test, expected)

Args:

  • buffer (List[SIMD[uint8, 1], hint_trivial_type])

item.title: to_ascii_uppercase
item.description:
Mojo function ðŸ¡­

to_ascii_uppercase

âž•  âž– 
fn to_ascii_uppercase(mut buffer: List[SIMD[uint8, 1], hint_trivial_type])

Uppercase all ascii a-zA-Z characters. 

from testing import assert_equal
from ExtraMojo.bstr.bstr import to_ascii_uppercase
var test = List("ABCdefgHIjklmnOPQRSTUVWXYZABCdefgHIjklmnOPQRSTUVWXYZABCdefgHIjklmnOPQRSTUVWXYZABCdefgHIjklmnOPQRSTUVWXYZABCdefgHIjklmnOPQRSTUVWXYZ".as_bytes())
var expected = List("ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ".as_bytes())
to_ascii_uppercase(test)
assert_equal(test, expected)

Args:

  • buffer (List[SIMD[uint8, 1], hint_trivial_type])
